instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
Arrived with minor liquid damage on U7941 Q7335 Q7330 Q2815 and Q2800. Replaced everything but still have 15V onPPBUS_G3H. Fan spins a couple seconds then stops then continues e.t.c

Replaced Q7030 Q7035 and U7000 at the same time but still 15V on PPBUS_G3H

What should be tried next?

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: Probably bad R/C7025 and Q7030 burnt again...

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: Changed R/C7025 U7000 Q7030/Q7035  at the same time.  Still 15V PPBUS_G3H

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
R7020 beeps with L7030?
If yes, Q7030 is shorted...

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: No beep between R7020 and L7030

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
Post again L7030 and R7020 voltage.
Did you solder correct Q7030?

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
L7030  15.70v

R7020  18.15V

yes used correct Q7030. Pulled from same model number donar

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: Change multimeter battery and measure again.

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: Remove F7040 and post again above voltages.

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
Really strange.
Post again all basic voltages for U7000; pins 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 9, 12, 13, 14, 15, 17, 19, 20, 27.
Keep F7040 removed.

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: Readings go from 15.70V at times to 4.45V at other times on L7030 even though there is a constant 1.6v on pin 17???

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message: they all check out good and traces are good

threads.title: 820-3115 no power
threads.message:
Pin 17 is directly connected to L7030.
At least should be, through 0+0.01 ohm=10 miliohm in total.
How can you get different DC voltage reading then???

BTW, measure ALWAYS DC voltage on the output pin of a coil from a buck-converter.
